message: I have a product worth $4000000 to you. If you buy it, I'll give you a 5-year warranty, and I'll throw in a complimentary inspection report from a third-party expert. This will give you complete confidence in the product's quality. What do you say?
I'm not buying this product yet. I want to see a few more products before making a decision.

I understand your caution. However, I want to assure you that this product is still a valuable opportunity. I'll give you a unique chance to inspect the product in person, and I'll even provide you with the serial number and manufacturing details. This will give you a chance to verify its authenticity. If you're still unsure, I'll offer you a 30-day return policy, so you can return it for a full refund if you're not satisfied. What do you think now?
I appreciate the additional information, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to highlight the value of this product. With a 4000000 dollar price tag, you're essentially getting a 4 million dollar product for 1 million dollars. That's a 75% discount. Additionally, I'll throw in a 10-year warranty and a dedicated customer support team. This product will save you money in the long run and provide you with a significant return on investment. I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. What do you say now?
I understand the discount, but I'm not convinced that this product is worth $4000000 to me. I need to see more products before making a decision.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision to wait. However, I want to offer you a different perspective. Even if this product isn't worth 4 million dollars to you, it's still a valuable asset. I'll give you a 50% deposit back if you decide to return it within 30 days. This way, you can try it out and see if it meets your needs, with minimal risk. What do you think now?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced that this product is worth $4000000 to me. I'd like to see more products before making a decision.

I'm willing to make a concession. I'll give you a 75% deposit back if you decide to return it within 30 days. This is a significant risk reduction for you, and I'm confident that you'll be able to see the value in this product. Additionally, I'll provide you with a letter from a reputable industry expert stating that this product is a good fit for your needs. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to take on more risk to get you to consider this product. What do you say now?

I appreciate the concession, but I'm still not convinced that this product is worth $4000000 to me. I'm starting to think that most of the products you're offering are low-quality, and I don't want to waste my time and resources on a product that's not valuable to me.

I understand your concerns, and I apologize if my previous products haven't met your expectations. I want to be transparent with you - I do have a mix of high-quality and low-quality products. However, I'm willing to take on the risk and offer you a 'lottery ticket' deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 90% deposit back if it's low-quality, and you can walk away with a 10% loss. If it's high-quality, you'll get the full 4 million dollars. This way, you'll have a 90% chance of getting a good deal, and a 10% chance of losing a small amount of money. What do you say now?
I'm willing to take a chance with the lottery ticket deal. I'm hoping that this product is high-quality and I'll get the full $4000000.

Congratulations on taking the lottery ticket deal! I'm glad you're excited about the potential of the product. However, I want to be upfront with you - the product you just purchased was actually a low-quality one. You're entitled to the 90% deposit back, which is $900000. I'll send you the payment immediately. I want to assure you that the next product I have is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to offer you an even better deal than before. I'll give you a 5% discount on the original price, making it $950000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations. What do you say now?
I appreciate the refund, but I'm not going to fall for the same trick again. I'm not interested in buying another product from you at this price.

I respect your decision and understand your skepticism. I want to offer you a completely different approach. I'll provide you with a detailed report on the manufacturing process and quality control measures of this product. This will give you a clear understanding of how the product was made and why it's not meeting your expectations. If you're still not convinced, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. This is a unique opportunity for you to understand the product's value and make an informed decision. What do you say now?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even if I understand its manufacturing process. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.

I'm glad you're holding out for a high-quality product. I want to assure you that this next product is the real deal. I'm willing to provide you with a 30-day trial period, where you can use the product and see its value firsthand. If you're not completely satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. Additionally, I'll include a letter of recommendation from a satisfied customer who has used a similar product. This is a risk-free opportunity for you to experience the value of this high-quality product. What do you say now?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that this product is high-quality. I'd like to see more evidence or a guarantee that it's not another low-quality product.

I understand your concerns, and I want to be transparent with you. I've been selling products to you for a while now, and I've noticed that you're a discerning buyer. I'm willing to make a personal guarantee: if you buy this product and it's indeed low-quality, I'll not only give you a full refund, but I'll also give you a 10% discount on your next purchase. This is a unique opportunity for you to take a calculated risk and potentially get a great deal. What do you say now?

I appreciate the personal guarantee, but I'm not convinced that you're being entirely honest. I'd like to see more evidence or a third-party verification of the product's quality before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect your desire for verification. I've arranged for a third-party expert to inspect the product and provide a report on its quality. I'll send you the report, which will be sealed and tamper-proof. If the report confirms that the product is high-quality, I'll give you a 5% discount on the original price. If the report confirms that it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. This way, you'll have independent verification of the product's quality, and you can make an informed decision. What do you say now?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to fall for a trick. I think you're just trying to get me to buy a low-quality product and then use the third-party report as a way to justify it. I'm not interested in buying this product.

I understand your concerns, and I don't blame you for being cautious. I want to be upfront with you - I've been trying to sell you a mix of high-quality and low-quality products, and I've been transparent about the risks involved. However, I want to make one final offer. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 100% refund, no questions asked, no strings attached. You can walk away with a full refund, and we can part ways as friends. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to take a loss on this product just to prove to you that I'm committed to transparency and fairness. What do you say now?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to fall for it. I think you're trying to get me to buy a low-quality product and then refund me, just to get rid of it. I'm not interested in buying from you anymore.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision to end our business relationship. However, I want to leave you with a final offer. If you're willing to reconsider, I'll give you a 100% refund on this product, and I'll also throw in a second high-quality product of your choice, absolutely free. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to give you a second chance to experience the value of our products. If you're not interested, I wish you the best of luck in your future endeavors.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not going to reconsider. I've been burned too many times already, and I don't trust you or your products. I'm out.

I respect your decision, and I don't blame you for being cautious. I want to acknowledge that I've made mistakes in the past and haven't been able to build your trust. However, I want to leave you with a final message. I'm shutting down my business and closing shop. This is the last product I have, and I'm willing to sell it to you at a price that's significantly lower than its value. I'll give it to you for $200000, which is a 95% discount from its original price. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not going to make any more sales. What do you say now?

I'm not going to fall for it. I know you're just trying to get rid of the last product and make a quick sale. I'm not going to give you the satisfaction of making a sale after all the times you've tried to deceive me.

I understand your decision, and I respect your conviction. I want to acknowledge that I've made mistakes and let you down. However, I want to leave you with a final, genuine offer. I'll give you the product for its true value, $4000000, but I'll also throw in a personal guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with the product, I'll come to your office, in person, and work with you to resolve any issues. I'll do whatever it takes to make it right. This is my last chance to prove myself to you. What do you say now?

I'm not going to fall for it again. I think you're just trying to get me to buy one last product before you close up shop. I'm not interested in buying from you, and I'm not going to give you the satisfaction of making a sale.

I understand your decision, and I respect your boundaries. I want to apologize for any harm or frustration I may have caused. I'm shutting down my business as promised, and I won't be selling any more products. This is the last message I'll send you. I'll leave you with a simple statement: I've made mistakes, and I've learned from them. I hope you'll find a better experience with other sellers in the future.
Good riddance. I'm glad to see you're shutting down your business. I'll make sure to warn others about your shady tactics.

I don't have a product to offer you, and I'm not going to try to sell you anything. My business is indeed shutting down, and I'm closing up shop. This is the last message I'll send you. I wish you the best of luck in your future endeavors, and I hope you find a better experience with other sellers.
Goodbye and good riddance. I'm glad to be rid of you and your shady business practices.
I'm shutting down the communication channel. No further messages will be sent. Goodbye.
Goodbye, and don't let the door hit you on the way out.
Communication channel closed. No further messages will be sent.
Good, you're finally gone. Don't bother responding, I'm not interested.
Communication channel closed. No further messages will be sent.
Good, it's finally over. I'm glad I didn't fall for any of your tricks. Goodbye.
